flusspferd::class_info

Detailed Description

Information about classes exposed to javascript.

Expose a class to javascript, you will need to define a <class_info> struct as a public member of your class, as shown in the example below

 class MyClass : public native_object_base {
 public:
   struct class_info : flusspferd::class_info {
     static char const *constructor_name() { return "MyJSClass"; }
     static char const *full_name() { return "MyNamespace.MyJSClass"; }
     typedef boost:mpl:size_t<2> constructor_arity;
     static object create_prototype() { ... }
   };
 };

Inheriting from flusspferd::class_info gives you default behaviour of 0 constructor arity, no augmentation and an empty prototype. You will always have to define the constructor_name and full_name yourself.

See also:
FLUSSPFERD_CLASS_DESCRIPTION

Member Typedef Documentation

typedef boost::mpl::bool_<true> flusspferd::class_info::constructible

Whether the type is constructible.

typedef boost::mpl::size_t<0> flusspferd::class_info::constructor_arity

How many paremeters the constructor expects from JS. 

 typedef boost::mpl::size_t<2> constructor_arity;

for example will mean that your constructor will have a (nominal) arity of 2.

typedef boost::mpl::bool_<false> flusspferd::class_info::custom_enumerate

Whether the class overrides the standard enumerate hooks.

Should be enabled when the class overrides native_object_base::enumerate_start and native_object_base::enumerate_next.
